channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves, 8th January
item.description:
Leaves in Penshurst Green, covering pavement and blocking drains. Please clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penshurst Green, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car crashed and left on pavement, 8th January
item.description:
This car has been left abandoned in this position since New Year. It appears to have damaged two other cars - one either side. It has been left half on the pavement and half on the road. It has not been attended.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeview Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree work scheduled but no work carried out, 8th January
item.description:
Tree outside 6 farmland walk had caused damage to property drive, has since been fixed but is a white circle around the tree, is chasing up for when this scheduled work to the tree would be carried out JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Farmland Walk, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Brondesbury Park/ The avenue, 8th January
item.description:
Overhanging branches, trees, blocking the whole pavement and roads. Full of debris, leaves, twigs leading from Brondesbury Park Station to The Avenue(can block the gullies) Please can all these trees be pruned back - reported many times before.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Aldi trolley, 8th January
item.description:

item.title: Broken, noisy manhole, 8th January
item.description:
The manhole right outside the building is broken and is merely covered by a metal cover that’s not sealed to the ground . This is obviously a hazard and dangerous as well as creating a very loud clanging noise whenever a car passes and that’s of course frequent

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27-29, Palace Gate, South Kensington, Greater London

item.title: Selsey Crescent, Tor Road, Okehampton Crescent, Bognor Road, Dorcis Avenue and Brampton Avenue needs cleaning as there are screws and nails everywhere, 8th January
item.description:
Selsey Crescent, Tor Road, Okehampton Crescent, Bognor Road, Dorcis Avenue and Brampton Avenue needs cleaning as there are screws and nails everywhere - A resident of Gipsy Road has been going out in the early hours throwing screws and nails around surrounding roads and drivers are having their tyres popped by these - resident was apparently arrested for the same issue in October. This is causing damage to driver's tyres and its getting worse and need clearing asap please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selsey Crescent, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
